tool.name: MaxQuant (using mqpar.xml)
tool.command:
## link galaxy datasets to filenames accepted by maxquant #import re #set names = [re.sub('@SUBSTITUTION_RX@', '_', str($n.element_identifier)) for $n in $input.infiles] #set names_with_ext = [($name if ($name).lower().endswith(str($input.ftype)) else $name + str($input.ftype)) for $name in $names] #for $target, $link in zip($infiles, $names_with_ext) ln -s '$target' '$link' && #end for
python3 '$__tool_directory__/modify_mqpar.py' --infiles='$infiles' --version=@VERSION@ --num_threads=\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-1} --substitution_rx='@SUBSTITUTION_RX@' --fasta_files='$fasta_files' --description_parse_rule='$description_parse_rule' --identifier_parse_rule='$identifier_parse_rule' '$mqpar'
&& maxquant mqpar.xml #if 'log' in $output: > '$log' #end if && mv '$mqpar' combined/txt/mqpar.xml #if 'output_all' in $output: && tar -zcf '$output_all' ./combined/txt #end if
#if "ptxqc_report" in $output: && Rscript '$qr' '$qr_yaml' #if 'log' in $output: >> '$log' 2>&1 #end if #end if

param.name: ftype
param.label: choose the type of your input files

param.name: infiles
param.label: RAW Files
param.help: Specify one or more Thermo RAW files

param.name: infiles
param.label: mzXML Files
param.help: Specify one or more mzXML files

param.name: infiles
param.label: mzML Files
param.help: Specify one or more mzML files

param.name: fasta_files
param.label: FASTA files
param.help: Specify one or more FASTA databases.

param.name: mqpar
param.label: mqpar.xml file with your search parameters. RAW file names must match the names displayed in galaxy. Their paths from the local machine are ignored. E.g. a file named 'test01.raw' in galaxy can either be named 'test01.raw' or 'D:\path\to\test01.raw' in the mqpar.xml.

tool.help:
MaxQuant is a quantitative proteomics software package designed for analyzing large mass-spectrometric data sets.
This tool is a wrapper for MaxQuant v@VERSION@. It gets its search parameters from a previously created parameter file (mqpar.xml). A similiar tool that allows the specification of search parameters directly through galaxy is available as well and should be preferred, if possible.
**Input files**
- Thermo raw file or mzXML file - The datatype has to be 'thermo.raw' or 'mzXML'. Make sure to specify the correct datatype either during upload to Galaxy or afterwards (edit attributes --> datatypes) - mqpar.xml: - MaxQuant parameters will be taken from the provided mqpar.xml file. This parameter file MUST be created using the same version of MaxQuant as is used by this tool. The correct version of MaxQuant can be obtained via the bioconda channel for the conda package manager.
**Output files**
Different output file options are available, most of them are part of the MaxQuant txt folder. An additional mztab output option is implemented.
